attributes.action: Reduce the salary of MPs so the money can be better spent in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
In many areas around the country youth sleep on the street with local councils unable to provide accommodation. The mental health sector fails to meet the needs of all people in the country and some families still struggle between eating or heating. 

Why then do MPs take inflated salaries? If they can't look after the people then they are not doing your job. It is the responsibility of our leaders to work for us and not for their own agenda
attributes.background:
The government takes a large amount of tax payers money for their own salary while other services lack.
When the country is desperate need to combat homelessness, mental health services, police on the street, poverty and many other issues our money is being mis-spent.
Parliament needs to change.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
